meanings.definition: A person who is believed to have the power to produce rain.
meanings.sent1: The villagers praised the rainmakers for ending the drought.
meanings.sent2: The indigenous tribe revered their rainmakers for their mystical abilities.
meanings.sent3: The rainmakers were the heroes of the village, bringing life to the dry lands.
meanings.sent4: The rainmakers' arrival was like a blessing from the heavens, bringing relief to the parched earth.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the rainmakers spread far and wide, captivating all who heard of their magical powers.

meanings.definition: A company or individual that is exceptionally successful in bringing in new business or revenue.
meanings.sent1: The tech giant was known as the rainmakers of the industry, sealing deals effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team proved to be true rainmakers, doubling the company's profits in a year.
meanings.sent3: The rainmakers of the business world always seemed to have a golden touch when it came to attracting clients.
meanings.sent4: In the competitive market, the rainmakers stood out like shining stars, drawing in customers with ease.
meanings.sent5: The company's rainmakers were like magicians, conjuring up success and prosperity wherever they went.
